Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of the project by stating that it is the largest private-sector infrastructure project in North American history.
Understate: The claim may be understating the progress of the project by implying that it has already been built or is under construction, when in fact it is not scheduled to begin construction until 2015, if at all.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the statement that the project is the largest private-sector infrastructure project in North American history.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the project will be successful and will lead America to energy independence, which may be a problematic assumption without further evidence or analysis.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors contributing to the push for the pipeline, such as economic or political motivations, which are not addressed in the claim.
